description: Let {f_n(k)} be the n-th sequence of Fibonacci-like numbers defined by recursion f_n(0) = 0, f_n(1) = 1 and, for k>=2, f_n(k) = f_n(k-1) + f_n(k-2) divided by maximal possible powers of primes >= prime(n). a(n) is length of the smallest period of {f_n(k)}, and a(n)=0, if {f_n(k)} is not eventually periodic.
